terrainmapper.name: Terrain Mapper
terrainmapper.controls.fill-by-grid.name: Fill by grid
terrainmapper.controls.fill-by-los.name: Fill by line-of-sight
terrainmapper.controls.fill-space.name: Fill space enclosed by walls
terrainmapper.controls.fill-polygon.name: Draw and fill a polygon
terrainmapper.controls.clear.name: Clear all
terrainmapper.controls.clear.confirm.con: Are you sure you want to remove all terrain data from the scene?
terrainmapper.controls.upload.name: Upload terrain data and replace in scene
terrainmapper.controls.download.name: Download terrain data
terrainmapper.controls.undo.name: Undo
terrainmapper.controls.terrain-menu.name: Terrains
terrainmapper.scene-config.backgroundEle: The default elevation for tokens placed on the canvas.
terrainmapper.scene-config.title: Advanced Scene Configuration
terrainmapper.scene-config.layer-elevati: Each layer can represent a distinct terrain at each pixel on the scene. To overlap terrains at a given pixel, you must use a different terrain layer for each overlapping terrain. A scene can hold a maximum of eight terrain layers. Each terrain layer can be set to a specific anchor elevation. Set the terrain property 'Anchor' to 'Relative to Layer Elevation' to force the terrain to follow the elevation of its respective layer.
terrainmapper.scene-config.pixels.hint-e: No terrains currently present in the scene. Please add terrains to the scene first.
terrainmapper.scene-config.pixels.hint: Select which terrains are represented in the scene by changing which pixel value is associated with a given terrain. This will change the terrain for every pixel of this value in the scene, on every terrain layer. A scene can hold a maximum of 15 terrains.
terrainmapper.list-config.title: Terrain List
terrainmapper.tile-config.transparency-t: Inner tile pixels with transparency less than this percent will be considered 'holes' when testing terrain.
terrainmapper.settings.auto_terrain.name: Auto-Terrain
terrainmapper.settings.auto_terrain.hint: Automatically set terrain on token movement.
terrainmapper.settings.auto_terrain_dial: Present dialog to GM when token terrain is added by Auto-Terrain
terrainmapper.settings.auto_terrain_disp: When adding terrain effect to a token, display a status icon.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.add-terrain: Select terrain that will be added to the token as an active effect.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.set-terrain: Select terrain that will be added to the token as an active effect. When the token exits the region, the terrain will be automatically removed.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.add-terrain: When enabled, the terrain can be added to a token more than once.
When enabled, all other terrains on the token will be removed.
When enabled, dragging the token will not reveal the existence of the terrain to users.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.remove-terr: Select one or more terrains that will be removed from the token. Leave blank to remove all terrains.
Enable to keep the selected terrains and remove all the rest from the token.
terrainmapper.behavior.types.set-elevati: When moving into the region, the token will be set to this elevation. For a typical scene, you should set the region top to this elevation and the region bottom to negative infinity.
When enabled, the token's elevation will be reset to the scene's background elevation when the token exits the region.
